raw.title: [TEMP CHECK] Add gmBTC on Arbitrum V3
raw.author: 0x08651EeE3b78254653062BA89035b8F8AdF924CE
raw.body:
---

**Title: [TEMP CHECK] Add gmBTC on Arbitrum V3
Author: @0xlide - @SaucyBlcok
Date: 2024-01-26**

---

## Summary
This publication presents the community an opportunity to add gmBTC to the Arbitrum Aave v3 Liquidity Pool.

## Motivation
GMX Protocol is the largest DEX offering derivatives and one of the most popular DeFi’s today. The introduction of several new features and integration with Chainlink Data Stream in GMX V2 has significantly reduced the risks of front-running and price manipulation compared to GMX V1. gmBTC is a BTC-USD's Liquidity Token on the GMX V2 and earn fees from leverage trading, borrowing fees and swaps. 

Integrating gmBTC as collateral asset in the Aave V3 Arbitrum Pool has the potential to create new demand for borrowable assets on Aave V3, such as WBTC and Stablecoin.

## Specifiction

Ticker: gmBTC
Contract Adress: [0x47c031236e19d024b42f8AE6780E44A573170703](https://arbiscan.io/token/0x47c031236e19d024b42f8AE6780E44A573170703)
Chainlink Oracle: [0x395D5c5D552Df670dc4B2B1cef0c4EABfFba492f](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x395d5c5d552df670dc4b2b1cef0c4eabffba492f)

Proposed risk parameters will be shared at the potential ARFC stage of this proposal.

## Reference
Project: [https://app.gmx.io/#/trade](https://app.gmx.io/#/trade)
GitHub: [https://github.com/gmx-io ](https://github.com/gmx-io)
Docs: [https://docs.gmx.io/docs/intro](https://docs.gmx.io/docs/intro)
Audit: [https://github.com/gmx-io/gmx-synthetics/tree/main/audits](https://github.com/gmx-io/gmx-synthetics/tree/main/audits)
Twitter: [https://twitter.com/GMX_IO?s=20 ](https://twitter.com/GMX_IO?s=20)
Discord: [https://discord.com/invite/H5PeQru3Aa](https://discord.com/invite/H5PeQru3Aa)

## Next Steps
1. Gather community feedback on this TEMP CHECK.
2. If consensus is reached, escalate this proposal to TEMP CHECK snapshot stage.
3. If TEMP CHECK snapshot outcome is YAE, escalate to ARFC stage.
4. If consensus on ARFC stage is reached and risk service providers provide feedback on risk parameters, escalate to ARFC snapshot stage.
5. If ARFC snapshot stage outcome is YAE, escalate to AIP stage

## Disclaimer
0xlide is not presenting this TEMP CHECK on behalf of any third party and is not compensated by any entity for creating this TEMP CHECK.

## Copyright
Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

raw.title: [ARFC] Add sFRAX on Ethereum V3
raw.author: 0xe2D6AA050C655a3F0f95eFD8F2107778090308aE
raw.body:
Title: [ARFC] Add sFRAX on Ethereum V3

Author: @0xlide, @SaucyBlock and ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)

Date: 2024-01-18

# Summary
This publication presents the community an opportunity to add sFRAX to the Ethereum Aave V3 Liquidity Pool.

# Motivation
Staked FRAX (sFRAX) is an ERC-4626 staking vault that distributes a portion of the Frax Protocol yield. sFRAX APY attempts to roughly track the interest on reserve balances (IORB) rate of the United States Federal Reserve.

Integrating sFRAX as collateral asset in the Aave V3 Ethereum Pool has the potential to create new demand for borrowable assets on Aave V3, such as stablecoins and FXS.

# Specification

Ticker: sFRAX
Contract Adress: 0xA663B02CF0a4b149d2aD41910CB81e23e1c41c32
Chainlink Oracle: 0xB9E1E3A9feFf48998E45Fa90847ed4D467E8BcfD


| Parameter               | Recommendation |
|-------------------------|----------------|
| Isolation Mode          | NO             |
| Borrowable in Isolation | NO             |
| Stable Borrow           | NO             |
| Enable Borrow           | NO             |
| Enable Collateral       | YES            |
| Loan To Value           | 70.00%         |
| Liquidation Threshold   | 75.00%         |
| Liquidation Bonus       | 6.00%          |
| Reserve Factor          | 20.00%         |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee| 20.00%         |
| Supply Cap(sFRAX)       | 10.00M         |
| Borrow Cap(sFRAX)       | N/A            |
| Uoptimal                | N/A            |
| Base                    | N/A            |
| Slope1                  | N/A            |
| Slope2                  | N/A            |


# Next Steps
1. If consensus on ARFC stage is reached and risk service providers provide feedback on risk parameters, escalate to ARFC snapshot stage.
2. If ARFC snapshot stage outcome is YAE, escalate to AIP stage

# Disclaimer
ACI is not presenting this ARFC on behalf of any third party and are not compensated by any entity for creating this ARFC.

# Copyright
Copyright and related rights waived via CC0.

raw.title: [ARFC] Add FXS to Ethereum V3
raw.author: 0x02fEb744cA516FD6E41D940Ae2d0F7Cb6FCB1ac3
raw.body:
title: [ARFC] Add FXS to Ethereum V3
author: @0xlide + Alice Rozengarden @Alice - Aave-chan initiative
created: 2023-10-13

---

## Summary

This publication presents the community an opportunity to add FXS to the Ethereum Aave v3 Liquidity Pool.

## Motivation

Frax Finance is a DeFi protocol that offers a stable protocol for issuing FRAX/FPI/frxETH and subprotocols such as Fraxlend, Fraxswap, and Fraxferry. The Frax Shares Token ($FXS) serves a dual role as both a governance token and a utility token.

The addition of FXS to Aave V3 represents the introduction of a new asset, encouraging the transition from Aave V2 to V3 and diversifying collateral assets for GHO. Furthermore, Aave DAO can utilize FXS obtained from the pool to kickstart the adoption of GHO and/or new aTokens.

## Specification

The parameters shown below are supported by @Gauntlet and @Chaoslabs with diverging opinions on the LT and LTV

Ticker: FXS
Contract Adress:[0x3432B6A60D23Ca0dFCa7761B7ab56459D9C964D0 ](https://etherscan.io/token/0x3432b6a60d23ca0dfca7761b7ab56459d9c964d0#code)
Chainlink Oracle: [0x6Ebc52C8C1089be9eB3945C4350B68B8E4C2233f](https://etherscan.io/address/0x6ebc52c8c1089be9eb3945c4350b68b8e4c2233f)

| Parameter | Recommendation (Gauntlet) | Recommendation (ChaosLabs) |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Isolation Mode | YES | YES |
| Borrowable | YES | YES |
| Collateral Enabled | YES | YES |
| Supply Cap (FXS) | 800,000 | 800,000 |
| Borrow Cap (FXS) | 500,000 | 500,000 |
| Debt Ceiling | $4M | $4M |
| **LTV** | **35.00%** | **50.00%** |
| **LT** | **45.00%** | **60.00%** |
| Liquidation Bonus | 10.00% | 10.00% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10.00% | 10.00% |
| Reserve Factor | 20.00% | 20.00% |
| Base Variable Borrow Rate | 0.00% | 0.00% |
| Variable Slope 1 | 9.00% | 9.00% |
| Variable Slope 2 | 300.00% | 300.00% |
| Uoptimal | 45.00% | 45.00% |
| Stable Borrowing | NO | NO |
| Stable Slope1 | 13.00% | 13.00% |
| Stable Slope2 | 300.00% | 300.00% |
| Base Stable Rate Offset | 3.00% | 3.00% |
| Stable Rate Excess Offset | 5.00% | 5.00% |
| Optimal Stable To Total Debt Ratio | 20.00% | 20.00% |
| Flahloanable | YES | YES |
| Siloed Borrowing | NO | NO |
| Borrowable in Isolation | NO | NO |

## Next Step

The following steps are as follow:
- If said snapshot is successful, escalate to an AIP.

## Disclaimer

The author is not presenting this ARFC on behalf of any third party and is not compensated by Frax for creating this proposal.

## Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via CC0.

raw.title: # [ARFC] Add GMX to Arbitrum v3
raw.author: 0x16645967f660AC05EA542D3DE2f46E41b86436d9
raw.body:
---

title: [ARFC] Add GMX to Arbitrum Aave v3
discussions: 
shortDescription: Add GMX to Aave v3 on Arbitrum Network.
author: @0xlide, @Llamaxyz
created: 2023-06-20

---

# Summary

This publication presents the community an opportunity to add GMX to the Arbitrum Aave v3 Liquidity Pool.

# Motivation

GMX Protocol is the largest DEX offering derivatives and one of the most popular DeFi's today. GMX Token is also one of the highest traded assets on Arbiturm.

The GMX token is the utility, governance, and fee accrual token for the GMX protocol. The GMX value accrual mechanism is unique to the GMX protocol. GMX is a highly staked asset, with approximately 78% of circulating GMX staked earning an APR of [2.94%](https://app.gmx.io/#/earn). This staking yield may generate borrowing demand for GMX, noting the yield is volatile.

Adding the GMX token to Arbitrum Aave v3 support greater asset diversification. Users will be able to deposit GMX as collateral and borrow GMX leading to additional revenue opportunities for Aave.

This publication contains risk paramters provided by Chaos Labs and Gauntlet. The initial forum discussion can be found [here](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-add-gmx-to-arbitrum-v3/12307/8). 

# Specification

The parameters shown below are supported by Gauntlet and Chaos Labs.

Ticker: GMX

Contract Address: [`0xfc5A1A6EB076a2C7aD06eD22C90d7E710E35ad0a`](https://arbiscan.io/token/0xfc5A1A6EB076a2C7aD06eD22C90d7E710E35ad0a)

Chainlink Oracle GMX/USD [`0xdb98056fecfff59d032ab628337a4887110df3db`](https://arbiscan.io/address/0xdb98056fecfff59d032ab628337a4887110df3db)

|Parameter|Value|
| --- | --- |
|Isolation Mode|Yes|
|Borrowable|Yes|
|Collateral Enabled|Yes|
|Supply Cap |110,000 units|
|Borrow Cap |60,000 units|
|Debt Ceiling|$2,500,000|
|LTV|45.00%|
|LT|55.00%|
|Liquidation Bonus|8.00%|
|Liquidation Protocol Fee |10.00%|
|Variable Base|0.00%|
|Variable Slope1|9.00%|
|Variable Slope2|300.00%|
|Uoptimal|45.00%|
|Silo Borrowing|No|
|eMode|No|
|Reserve Factor|20.00%|
|Stable Borrowing|Disabled|
|Stable Slope1|0.00%|
|Stable Slope2|0.00%|
|Base Stable Rate Offset|0.00%|
|Stable Rate Excess Offset|13.00%|
|Optimal Stable To Total Debt Ratio|20.00%|

# Disclaimer

Neither @0xlide and/or @Llamaxyz are affiliated with GMX or any other entity and has not received payment to present this ARFC.

At the time of writing, both @lide and @llamaxyz, do not possess any GMX. @lide holds only a small amount of GLP.

@llamaxyz has supported the drafting of this proposal and will prepare the payload for listing GMX on Arbitrum v3, pending successful Snapshot vote.

# Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

decision.summary: Proposal to add gmBTC as a collateral asset on Aave V3 Arbitrum pool with parameters recommended by Chaos Labs, aiming to expand borrowable asset options and leverage GMX Protocol's derivative products.
key_arguments_for: Integration of gmBTC offers new demand for borrowable assets and exposure to GMX's derivative markets.
Chaos Labs supports the proposal with detailed risk parameters ensuring sound risk management.
Previous similar proposals adding new assets with YAE outcomes showed positive price and TVL impacts.
Timeline voting strongly supports YAE option with early and stable lead throughout.
key_arguments_against: Some forum participants express concerns about delays in onboarding and governance process bottlenecks.
Sentiment in forum is mixed with more negative than positive comments, reflecting some community frustration.
Liquidity and liquidation risks exist due to gmBTC's composition and non-atomic liquidation process.
Borrowing is disabled to mitigate risk, but supply cap and liquidation bonuses required to manage exposure.

evidence.quote: Forum discussion shows 15 posts with 2 positive, 8 negative, 5 neutral sentiments before proposal end. Initial comments outline proposal details, later posts discuss onboarding delays and governance inefficiencies.
Voting timeline metrics show unanimous lead for YAE with 100% lead ratio by quartile, stable voting pattern, and early voting dominance.
Three similar recent proposals to add assets with YAE results, positive price impacts (~5-6%) and TVL gains (~7-13%), indicating market confidence.

decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'YAE' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Timeline analytics reveal overwhelming and stable support for 'YAE', indicating strong voter confidence.
- Market impacts from similar past proposals show positive price and TVL responses, supporting asset integration.
- Forum sentiment is mixed with more negative comments, mostly about onboarding delays and process issues; however, the recommendation aligns with the majority voting trend, reflecting overall community support for change.
- Risk mitigations including supply caps, no borrowing, and liquidation parameters recommended by Chaos Labs reduce systemic risk, making the proposal a prudent expansion.
- Lessons from historical proposals confirm that asset additions with robust risk frameworks and strong voter backing tend to benefit the protocol's health.
